elements.title: Ingush towers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ingushetia is often called the "land of towers" after the Ingush towers (examples pictured), unique medieval monuments found throughout the region?

elements.title: Something Like This (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the album Something Like This by Ben Rector debuted at number one on iTunes' singer-songwriter album chart five minutes after its release?

elements.title: Maria Leshern von Herzfeld (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Maria Leshern von Herzfeld helped to organise the prison escape of the Russian revolutionary Peter Kropotkin?

elements.title: Boundary Fire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Boundary Fire burned 17,788 acres (7,199 ha) of the Coconino and Kaibab National Forests in Arizona?

elements.title: Valentine Strudwick (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Valentine Strudwick enlisted to serve in the First World War at 14 years old?

elements.title: The Seoul Press (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Seoul Press was an English-language newspaper created to justify Japan's colonial rule of Korea?

elements.title: Karl Frederik Kinch (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that archaeologist Karl Frederik Kinch identified the location of Stagira, the hometown of Aristotle?

elements.title: checking account (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the US federal government's "checking account" held more than $800 billion at the beginning of February 2024?
